title: Supabase
description: Integration with Supabase backend-as-a-service platform enabling database operations and Edge Function invocations

fetch_data.title: Fetch Data
fetch_data.description: Fetch data from Supabase tables with filtering, ordering, and pagination support

insert_data.title: Insert Data
insert_data.description: Insert new records into Supabase tables

update_data.title: Update Data
update_data.description: Update existing records in Supabase tables based on filter conditions

upsert_data.title: Upsert Data
upsert_data.description: Insert or update records in Supabase tables based on conflict resolution

delete_data.title: Delete Data
delete_data.description: Delete records from Supabase tables based on filter conditions

invoke_function.title: Invoke Edge Function
invoke_function.description: Invoke Supabase Edge Functions with optional parameters and headers

supabase_url.title: Supabase URL
supabase_url.description: Your Supabase project URL (e.g., https://your-project.supabase.co). You can find it in Project Settings -> Data API

supabase_key.title: Supabase API Key
supabase_key.description: Your Supabase project's API key. You can find it in Project Settings -> API Keys

public_key.title: Public API Key
public_key.description: You can add a key with more restrictive permissions for public skills. If not provided, supabase_key will be used.

public_write_tables.title: Public Write Tables
public_write_tables.description: Add tables separated by commas. When insert, update, upsert, or delete operations are enabled for public use, only tables from this list can be used. This list does not restrict the skills executed by the owner or in autonomous chat. You can use either this option or public_key to secure your public access.
